turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: The turbine blew.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Lemme see, was that before or after the oil fire?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: You'd think on a ship this size there'd be something left to eat.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: After fifty years there ain't nothin' left but shoe leather.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Where from?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Amidships starboard at the beam. Just under the waterline. I don't think it's a problem.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: One more?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Why not.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What is your first name?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: It just occurred to me I don't know your first name. All this time and I don't know it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maureen.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maureen.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Maureen?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Roger?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: You think that's funny

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Probably slipped her moorings, got tangled up in a current.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Out here? What, so a seven hundred foot passenger liner drifted out of Spokane harbor and nobody managed to bump into her until now?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Somebody's probably looking for her as we speak.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Seeing as though a foot of one of these fuckers weighs about a hundred pounds, it ain't gonna be what you'd call easy.  Any questions?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Supposing one of those cables breaks under tow.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Then we'll all be doomed. Any other questions?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Bring it on, dude.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Nobody just scuttles a passenger liner either.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Ever heard of insurance, big boy?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: If this thing turns out to be a ship everybody thought sank a long time ago, we just hit the jackpot.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah, well how the hell you get something like that wrong? That's a damn big boat. It's either sunk or it ain't.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Last thing we want is extra partners.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Or uninvited guests.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: This's gonna hurt a little.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Thanks for the warning -- Ow! Damn!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What other choices have we got?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I tell you one thing, we're not gonna be towing no ship now.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Guess I'll just keep working.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What're you crazy?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I like my job.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Light in those passages ain't so good.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I'm telling you, I saw somebody. I don't know who it was. But I saw somebody.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe that is his boat.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Gimme a break.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Fifty million dollars. Fifty million. We gonna let this guy just take it from us? One guy?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: So we kill him?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I'm saying we gotta do whatever we gotta do to preserve our interest.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: One guy isn't gonna be so stupid.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe he isn't alone.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Pretty handy with that scatter gun, Epps. You raised on a farm?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Seen a lota movies.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Smokes?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I'm no doctor. But I'd say he's in a coma.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know what else you'd call it. He's breathing on his own, but his pupils are completely blown out. He's totally unresponsive to pain.  What happened up there?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I heard a scream. When I got there I found him on the floor. He was having some kind of seizure. I didn't see anybody else.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Other than the obvious, there's nothing wrong with him that I can see, not on the outside.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Then what the hell happened to him?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Try Wednesday.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Right. Wednesday.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Hell no. You think I'm crazy?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What say, Epps? You up for some roasted albatross?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Dodge.  Dodge.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Get up.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You aren't jealous, are you Dodge?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Are you kidding me? Jealous? Epps? Gimme a break.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What the hell would a freighter be doing up here? It's way out of the lanes. There's not a port for 800 miles.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Smugglers maybe.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah, from one side of the harbor to the other. But we got half the Bering Sea and the whole Alaskan gulf to drag her over.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You have any idea how much a ship like that could be worth in salvage? The fittings alone could go for a few million.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: If you get it back in one piece.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It's a risk I'm willing to take.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: It's a bloody navigation hazard. One boat can't control a ship that size.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The damn thing's been floating around for God knows how long and it hasn't hit anything yet. So we take it easy. A little of the old push pull.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: With a little extra fuel, weather permitting, we should make Sitka in five days without another stop.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Sounds reasonable.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Mother fucker!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Threw a turbine blade.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: The number one turbine's pretty well trashed. Number two runs, but it's way underpowered.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How long to fix?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Hard to say. I gotta get in there and have a look. At least a couple days. Depending.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Turbine rotor's shot.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I thought you said it was just a blade.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Metal's crystallized. Gotta replace the whole deal.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How much longer's that gonna take?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Like I always say --

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I know I know, two ways to do anything --

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: The right way and the wrong way.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: But how long?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Hard to say.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We gotta get outa here, Dodge. A storm blows up and we're history.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I'm telling you, you don't want to be running that fan like it is.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What about running number two by itself?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: It's a full 2500 horses down. We couldn't drag that boat down hill on ice with it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How long, then?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I gotta pull the blades and re-seat everything in a new rotor -- .

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Three, four days.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Goddamit, Dodge.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What do you want me to tell you, that we can throw this sucker back in and start pulling her like nothing happened? Can't do it, skipper.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Obviously it's some kind of screw up. The shipping records aren't a hundred percent accurate.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Man, it gives me the creeps. We got no business towing a ship that size anyway. I say we fix the turbines and hit the highway.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Went aboard.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: She take a radio?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It's a hell of a lot of money.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What, you think there's something funny about it?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: A ship with fifty million dollars in gold aboard, adrift? And nobody seems to care enough to come looking for it?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Didn't happen yesterday, I'll tell you that. Torn parts rusted bad as the rest of the boat.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Then it happened before they scuttled her.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Or somebody stopped them.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Either way, they must've had a pretty good reason.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: So what're we gonna do. That's the big question, right?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: A salvage claim to a vessel's cargo's as valid as a claim to the vessel itself. It's ours.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Then we're rich. We're damn, filthy stinking rich.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It looks like it.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: You gotta be kidding? What the hell we need that tub for, we got fifty million bucks?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: So we get a little more for the boat. Besides, the gold'll be safer where it is.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. I'm on it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The sooner we get under way, the sooner we are to spending what's ours.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I'm buyin' me a nice outrigger. Spend my time hauling rich Seattle business men through the Puget.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How about you Epps?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Dreamin's all any of you're gonna be doing if we don't get this boat running.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Sounds like the hull.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Warm water current maybe, making the metal expand.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: If somebody's aboard her already, she ain't ours. She's theirs.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Bullshit. That boat hasn't made steam for fifty years. We found her. She's ours.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Not in the eyes of the law.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I say fuck the motherfucker. We're a professional salvage crew going about our business. What's some yahoo doing way out here by himself anyway?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: And what do you propose? That we knock this guy off?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Why not? Why the fuck not?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What if that fucker finds it before we're ready to go?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We'll stand a watch. Four on, eight off. Low man first.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: If he's reasonable, maybe we can make some kind of deal. If not. We'll have to re-consider our options.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah, reconsider fucking his shit up.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Bodies're too fresh.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Fresh ain't the first word that comes to mind.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Damn barbaric is what it is.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Could be meant as a warning.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: That'd be my guess.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: So whoever did this might still be around.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Can't you use something else?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I might be able to find something on the ship. But it's gonna take time.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Do what you need to do. Just do it fast.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Dodge to Murphy.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Murphy.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: You better get down here quick, skipper. I'm on "C" deck. Cabin 400.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I think you better see this for yourself.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It was a man's voice. Repeating some sort of children's rhyme. I don't know, it didn't make any sense. You didn't hear it?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Not me.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: On a passenger ship in 1953?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: If they knew what they were carrying.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: So. I got a question. Just from a, you know, purely technical standpoint. We call the Coastguard.  Coastguard shows up. What exactly is the plan?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How do you mean?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Well, they're gonna be asking a lot of questions. About us. About those bodies. About the gold. Seems like we oughta be prepared is all.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I guess the best strategy's just to tell them the truth.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Yeah, well. The truth is one thing. When there's more than a few hundred million dollars involved, that's a whole new deal.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What do you propose?

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: For starters, getting that gold off the ship. What they don't know about isn't gonna bother them.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: There's no way we're gonna hide a few thousand pounds of gold from the Coastguard here. Besides, it'll be safer where it is.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: With all due respect, skipper.  Part of that up there's mine. I'd kinda like to have a little say in what happens to it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing?!

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I think you know.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Maybe you can tell me then.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The radio!

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: The radio. Oh, yeah, the radio.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Take it easy, willya? What about the radio?!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You smashed it!

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Don't lie to me!

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: What the fuck -- ?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You didn't want us calling anybody. Too liable to ruin your big payday.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I didn't touch the fucking radio.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I didn't touch the fucking radio!  Ever occur to you there's somebody else on that boat, skipper?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Conveniently enough for you.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Look, I didn't touch it. Alright?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: You better get down here right now! We're taking water! Big time!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What the hell happened!

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Turbine chamber on number two must've blown! Took out part of the hull!

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: That oughta buy a man pretty much anything he wants.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: If money can buy what he wants.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: I don't figure there's much I want money can't buy.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Then you're a lucky man.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We'll stand the watch on deck tonight. You're up first.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Tomorrow we'll see if we can't find some line and tackle. Use some of those bodies below decks for bait.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: There's a charming thought.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Don't fall asleep.

turns.speaker: DODGE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: What's slow?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe twenty gallons an hour.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Morning everybody.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Show your tatoos to that coxswain last night, did you Epps?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Showed him a hell of a lot more than that.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I bet you did.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Could be a fishing boat.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Too big. More like a freighter.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Looks like one hell of a stick up his ass.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: He'd let you off at the nearest port, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You mean, before she sank.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Cargo like this could make a crew think twice.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Then why didn't they take it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Probably didn't have time.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Two hundred twenty two kilograms of solid gold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: That's what I call a payday.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Hell yeah.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: That's a good thing?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Hell, yeah. I like it cold. Colder the better.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: What'd he look like?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe six feet. Lanky. I didn't get a good look. He was far away. But I saw him. I saw him as sure as you're standing there.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Coffee.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You're a pal.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Stay away. Or else.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Because of the gold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Any dizziness?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Headache, nausea, lights?

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: Lights?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Sudden flashes of light.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I feel fine.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I don't even want to know what that's gonna taste like now.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Better than starving to death.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah. Fine. I just thought I heard something is all.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Nothing. Let's get outa here.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I can't believe you. Dodge's dead and all you can think about is cashing in your share.

turns.speaker: GREER
turns.text: I didn't sign up to go home empty handed. And I sure ain't gonna roll over for the freaky motherfucker did this.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Candy?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's my pen name.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Go on.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Salvage fees on a vessel like this could come in around four million bucks. At least. Who knows, could be more. Could be a lot more.  What I'm proposing is... we split it four ways.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: The law's on our side. If they want to challenge it, let them try.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They must've scuttled it. Nobody just lets a ship float away.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Coffee?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Yeah. Thanks.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What'd you find up there?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Some charts. A crew manifest.  Looks like her last voyage was January 1953. The question is where the hell's she been since.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: She was sailing up north, right?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Her destination was Halifax, yeah.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Well, suppose she got a little further north than she should have.  Got stuck in the ice. The passengers and crew evacuated. She froze into the ice pack, which moved further north, where it froze in solid. They write it off. Fifty years later, the whole global warming thing happens. The ice melts, she gets loose and floats around til somebody runs into her.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Ever heard of the Mary Celeste?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: She was a two-masted brig boat sailing out of New York in 1872.  One day she was sighted off the coast of Portugal by a merchant vessel, the Dei Gratia. As the crew of the Dei Gratia got closer, they discovered that no one was at the helm of the Mary Celeste. On boarding, they found her completely deserted. The captain, his wife, their daughter, and the entire crew, all gone. The last entry in their log made no mention of any trouble. The table was even set for dinner. And in the nine days after the last entry, she sailed 700 miles without anyone aboard.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: So what did happen?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Nobody knows. There've been a lot of theories, of course. But we'll never really know for sure.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You think she's sailing without a crew?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I think we'd be surprised where a drifting ship might wind up with a little wind and the right current.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You're more practical than superstitious.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Only way to be.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe they didn't want it back. Maybe the whole fat deal was insured.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Maybe. But there's always somebody whose interest's at stake.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Why not call for help?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: For now the best thing we can do is to keep quiet about this.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Take it easy, you'll live longer.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Did you see him?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: The guy. He just came this way.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What guy?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: There's somebody else on this boat.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What? What the hell're you talking about.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I saw him. Just a minute ago. Some guy.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Of course I'm sure. I saw him.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You sure it wasn't me?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It wasn't you. It was somebody else. There's somebody else aboard.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: So, we find this guy and make a deal with him.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We don't exactly have the best bargaining position.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Guess that'd be me. Again.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Dodge, get on that turbine. I don't care if you don't sleep for a week. The sooner you're done, the sooner we can get out of here. How's the food situation?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: No cowboy shit up there, understand?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No cowboy shit. Right.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Got your light?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yup.
